attr_dc_description.lang: Ziel dieses Kurses ist, die Funktionalität und Leistungsfähigkeit der ADL BEISPIEL Lauf-zeit Umgebung zu demonstrieren. CTC does not recommend, propose or otherwise promote the style, fashion, or type of content presented in this course.

The purpose of this course is to demonstrate the functionality and capability of the ADL SAMPLE Run-time Environment. CTC does not recommend, propose or otherwise promote the style, fashion, or type of content presented in this course.

text.lang: REFERENZ: U.S. Coast Guard, Commandant Instruction M16672.2C
REFERENCE: U.S. Coast Guard, Commandant Instruction M16672.2C
Die Inhalte dieses Kurses entsprechen den Regeln der U.S.-Küstenwache für Wasserstrassen in Übereinstimmung mit U.S. Bestimmungen.
The material of this course is of the U.S Coast Guard's Rules of the Road in compliance with U.S. Regulations.

ZIEL DER ÜBUNG: Dieser Kurs möchte dem Lernenden ein grundsätzliches Verständnis von den inländischen Richtlinien der Navigation vermitteln. These rules have been Coast Guard approved according to the instruction listed above and U.S. Law.

LESSON OBJECTIVE: This course will give the student a basic understanding of the Inland Rules of Navigation. These rules have been Coast Guard approved according to the instruction listed above and U.S. Law.

titlealt.lang: Führung von Schiffen bei jedweder Sicht
Conduct of Vessels in any Condition of Visibility

title.lang: Führung von Schiffen bei jedweder Sicht
Conduct of Vessels in any Condition of Visibility

text.lang: DEFINITIONEN:
DEFINITIONS:

Unterwegs
Das Schiff hat keinen Anker gelassen und ist nicht auf Grund gelaufen
Länge
Die gesamte Länge des Schiffs
Breite
Die grösste Breite des Schiffs
Eingeschränkte Sicht
Alle Bedingungen unter denen die Sicht durch Nebel, Dunst, Schnee, Regen oder Sandstürme behindert ist
Inländische Gewässer
The navigable waters of the U.S. shoreward of the navigational demarcation lines dividing the high seas from harbors, rivers, and other inland waters of the U.S. and the waters of the Great Lakes on the U.S. side of the International Boundary
Inländische Richtlinien oder Richtlinien
The Inland Navigational Rules which govern the conduct of vessels and specify the lights, shapes, and sound signals that apply to inland waters according to the above listed U.S. Coast Guard instruction
Internationale Regelungen
International regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea, 1972 currently in force for the U.S.

underway
The vessel is not at anchor or has not run aground
length
The vessels overall length
breadth
The vessels greatest breadth
restricted visibility
Any condition in which visibility is restricted by fog, mist, snow, rain, or sandstorms
inland waters
The navigable waters of the U.S. shoreward of the navigational demarcation lines dividing the high seas from harbors, rivers, and other inland waters of the U.S. and the waters of the Great Lakes on the U.S. side of the International Boundary
inland rules or rules
The Inland Navigational Rules which govern the conduct of vessels and specify the lights, shapes, and sound signals that apply to inland waters according to the above listed U.S. Coast Guard instruction
international regulations
International regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea, 1972 currently in force for the U.S.
Ausblick:
Look-out:
Every vessel shall, at all times, maintain a proper look-out by sight and heading as well as additional look-outs should the weather and/or visibility decline
Every vessel shall, at all times, maintain a proper look-out by sight and heading as well as additional look-outs should the weather and/or visibility decline

titlealt.lang: Führung von Schiffen in Sichtweite zueinander
Conduct of Vessels in Sight of One Another

title.lang: Führung von Schiffen in Sichtweite zueinander
Conduct of Vessels in Sight of One Another

text.lang: Segelschiffe
Sailing Vessels

<dl> <dt>a) Wenn zwei Segelschiffe einander mit dem möglichen Risiko einer Kollision begegnen, soll eines von beiden dem anderen wie folgt ausweichen: <dl> <dt>1) When each has the wind on a different side, the vessel which has the wind on the port side shall keep out of the way of the other <dt>2) When both have the wind on the same side, the vessel which is windward shall keep out of the way of the vessel which is to leeward <dt>3) If a vessel with the wind on the port side sees a vessel to windward and cannot determine with certainty whether the other vessel has the wind on the port or on the starboard side, she shall keep out of the way of the other. </dl> <dt>b) For the purpose of this Rule the windward side shall be deemed to be the side opposite to that on which the mainsail is carried or, in the case of a square-rigged vessel, the side opposite to that on which the largest fore-and-aft sail is carried </dl>

<dl> <dt>a) When two sailing vessels are approaching one another, with a possible risk of collision, one of them shall keep out of the way of the other as follows: <dl> <dt>1) When each has the wind on a different side, the vessel which has the wind on the port side shall keep out of the way of the other <dt>2) When both have the wind on the same side, the vessel which is windward shall keep out of the way of the vessel which is to leeward <dt>3) If a vessel with the wind on the port side sees a vessel to windward and cannot determine with certainty whether the other vessel has the wind on the port or on the starboard side, she shall keep out of the way of the other. </dl> <dt>b) For the purpose of this Rule the windward side shall be deemed to be the side opposite to that on which the mainsail is carried or, in the case of a square-rigged vessel, the side opposite to that on which the largest fore-and-aft sail is carried </dl>
Überholen
Overtaking

<dl> <dt>a) Notwithstanding anything contained in any of the above Rules, any vessel overtaking any other shall keep out of the way of the vessel being overtaken. <dt>b) A vessel shall be deemed to be overtaking when coming up with another vessel from a direction more than 22.5 degrees abaft her beam; that is, in such a position with reference to the vessel she is overtaking, that at night she would be able to see only the sternlight of that vessel but neither of her sidelights. <dt>c) When a vessel is in any doubt as to whether she is overtaking another, she shall assume that this is the case and act accordingly. <dt>d) Any subsequent alteration of the bearing between the two vessels shall not make the overtaking vessel a crossing vessel within the meaning of these Rules or relieve her of the duty of keeping clear of the overtaken vessel until she is finally past and clear </dl>

<dl> <dt>a) Notwithstanding anything contained in any of the above Rules, any vessel overtaking any other shall keep out of the way of the vessel being overtaken. <dt>b) A vessel shall be deemed to be overtaking when coming up with another vessel from a direction more than 22.5 degrees abaft her beam; that is, in such a position with reference to the vessel she is overtaking, that at night she would be able to see only the sternlight of that vessel but neither of her sidelights. <dt>c) When a vessel is in any doubt as to whether she is overtaking another, she shall assume that this is the case and act accordingly. <dt>d) Any subsequent alteration of the bearing between the two vessels shall not make the overtaking vessel a crossing vessel within the meaning of these Rules or relieve her of the duty of keeping clear of the overtaken vessel until she is finally past and clear </dl>

titlealt.lang: Führung von Schiffen bei eingeschränkter Sicht
Conduct of Vessels in Restricted Visibility

title.lang: Führung von Schiffen bei eingeschränkter Sicht
Conduct of Vessels in Restricted Visibility

text.lang: <dl> <dt>a) Diese Regel gilt für Schiffe ohne Sicht auf einander beim Navigieren in oder nahe eines Gebiets mit eingeschränkter Sicht. <dt>b) Every vessel shall proceed at a safe speed adapted to the prevailing circumstances and conditions of restricted visibility. A power driven vessel shall have her engines ready for immediate maneuver. <dt>c) Every vessel shall have due regard to the prevailing circumstances and conditions of restricted visibility when complying with the above Rules <dt>d) A vessel which detects by radar alone the presence of another vessel shall determine if a close-quarters situation is developing or risk of collision exists. If so, she shall take avoiding action in ample time, provided that when such action consists of an alteration of course, so far as possible the following shall be avoided: <dl> <dt>1) An alteration of course to port for a vessel forward of the beam, other than for a vessel being overtaken; and <dt>2) An alteration of course toward a vessel abeam or abaft the beam </dl> <dt>e) Except where it has been determined that a risk of collision does not exist, every vessel which hears apparently forward of her beam the fog signal of another vessel, or which cannot avoid a close quarters situation with another vessel forward of her beam, shall reduce her speed to the minimum at which she can be kept on course. She shall if necessary take all her way off and, in any event, navigate with extreme caution until danger of collision is over. </dl>

<dl> <dt>a) This Rule applies to vessels not in sight of one another when navigating in or near an area of restricted visibility. <dt>b) Every vessel shall proceed at a safe speed adapted to the prevailing circumstances and conditions of restricted visibility. A power driven vessel shall have her engines ready for immediate maneuver. <dt>c) Every vessel shall have due regard to the prevailing circumstances and conditions of restricted visibility when complying with the above Rules <dt>d) A vessel which detects by radar alone the presence of another vessel shall determine if a close-quarters situation is developing or risk of collision exists. If so, she shall take avoiding action in ample time, provided that when such action consists of an alteration of course, so far as possible the following shall be avoided: <dl> <dt>1) An alteration of course to port for a vessel forward of the beam, other than for a vessel being overtaken; and <dt>2) An alteration of course toward a vessel abeam or abaft the beam </dl> <dt>e) Except where it has been determined that a risk of collision does not exist, every vessel which hears apparently forward of her beam the fog signal of another vessel, or which cannot avoid a close quarters situation with another vessel forward of her beam, shall reduce her speed to the minimum at which she can be kept on course. She shall if necessary take all her way off and, in any event, navigate with extreme caution until danger of collision is over. </dl>
Anbringung
Application

<dl> <dt>a) Rules in this Part shall be complied with in all weathers <dt>b) The Rules concerning lights shall be complied with from sunset to sunrise, and during such times no other lights shall be exhibited, except such lights as cannot be mistaken for the lights specified in these Rules or do not impair their visibility or distinctive character, or interfere with the keeping of a proper look-out <dt>c) The lights prescribed by these Rules shall also be exhibited from sunrise to sunset in restricted visibility and may be exhibited in all other circumstances when it is deemed necessary <dt>d) The Rules concerning shapes shall be complied with by day </dl>

<dl> <dt>a) Rules in this Part shall be complied with in all weathers <dt>b) The Rules concerning lights shall be complied with from sunset to sunrise, and during such times no other lights shall be exhibited, except such lights as cannot be mistaken for the lights specified in these Rules or do not impair their visibility or distinctive character, or interfere with the keeping of a proper look-out <dt>c) The lights prescribed by these Rules shall also be exhibited from sunrise to sunset in restricted visibility and may be exhibited in all other circumstances when it is deemed necessary <dt>d) The Rules concerning shapes shall be complied with by day </dl>
Definitionen
Definitions

masthead light
A white light placed over the fore and aft centerline of the vessel showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of 225 degrees and so fixed as to show the light from right ahead to 22.5 degrees abaft the beam on either side of the vessel, except that on a vessel of less than 12 meters in length the masthead light shall be placed as nearly as practicable to the fore and aft centerline of the vessel
Sidelights
A green light on the starboard side and a red light on the port side each showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of 112.5 degrees and so fixed as to show the light from right ahead to 22.5 degrees abaft the beam on its respective side. On a vessel of less than 20 meters in length the sidelights may be combined in one lantern carried on the fore and aft centerline of the vessel, except that on a vessel of less than 12 meters in length the side-lights when combined in one lantern shall be placed as nearly as practicable to the fore and aft centerline of the vessel.
Sternlight
A white light placed as nearly as practicable at the stern showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of 135 degrees and so fixed as to show the light 67.5 degrees from right aft on each side of the vessel.
towing light
A yellow light having the same characteristics as the "sternlight"
all-round light
A light showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of 360 degrees
flashing light
A light flashing at regular intervals at a frequency of 120 flashes or more per minute
special flashing light
A yellow light flashing at regular intervals at a frequency of 50 to 70 flashes per minute, placed as far forward and as nearly as practicable on the fore and aft centerline of the tow and showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of not less than 180 degrees nor more than 225 degrees and so fixed as to show the light from right ahead to abeam and no more than 22.5 degrees abaft the beam on either side of the vessel

masthead light
A white light placed over the fore and aft centerline of the vessel showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of 225 degrees and so fixed as to show the light from right ahead to 22.5 degrees abaft the beam on either side of the vessel, except that on a vessel of less than 12 meters in length the masthead light shall be placed as nearly as practicable to the fore and aft centerline of the vessel
Sidelights
A green light on the starboard side and a red light on the port side each showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of 112.5 degrees and so fixed as to show the light from right ahead to 22.5 degrees abaft the beam on its respective side. On a vessel of less than 20 meters in length the sidelights may be combined in one lantern carried on the fore and aft centerline of the vessel, except that on a vessel of less than 12 meters in length the side-lights when combined in one lantern shall be placed as nearly as practicable to the fore and aft centerline of the vessel.
Sternlight
A white light placed as nearly as practicable at the stern showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of 135 degrees and so fixed as to show the light 67.5 degrees from right aft on each side of the vessel.
towing light
A yellow light having the same characteristics as the "sternlight"
all-round light
A light showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of 360 degrees
flashing light
A light flashing at regular intervals at a frequency of 120 flashes or more per minute
special flashing light
A yellow light flashing at regular intervals at a frequency of 50 to 70 flashes per minute, placed as far forward and as nearly as practicable on the fore and aft centerline of the tow and showing an unbroken light over an arc of the horizon of not less than 180 degrees nor more than 225 degrees and so fixed as to show the light from right ahead to abeam and no more than 22.5 degrees abaft the beam on either side of the vessel
Ton und Lichtsignale
Sound and Light Signals

whistle--Any sound signaling appliance capable of producing the prescribed blasts and which complies with the specifications in Annex III of the referenced instruction
short blast--A blast of about a one second duration.
prolonged blast--A blast of from four to six seconds' duration.

whistle--Any sound signaling appliance capable of producing the prescribed blasts and which complies with the specifications in Annex III of the referenced instruction
short blast--A blast of about a one second duration.
prolonged blast--A blast of from four to six seconds' duration.

title.lang: Inland Rules of the Road - 1st Exam

text.lang: Bitte beantworten Sie die folgenden Fragen.
Please answer the following questions.

xqText.lang: Ein motor-getriebenes Schiff soll sich unterwegs fernhalten von:
A power-driven vessel underway shall keep out of:

xqiFeedback.lang: Dies ist korrekt, aber es ist nicht die einzige Antwort!
This is correct, but it is not the only answer!

xqiText.lang: A vessel restricted in her ability to maneuver

xqiFeedback.lang: Dies ist korrekt, aber es ist nicht die einzige Antwort!
This is correct, but it is not the only answer!
Dies ist korrekt, aber es ist nicht die einzige Antwort!
This is correct, but it is not the only answer!

xqText.lang: Auf welcher Seite soll ein grünes Lauflicht angebracht werden?
On which side shall a green running light be displayed?

xqiFeedback.lang: Dies ist falsch, es soll auf einer Seite angebracht werden!
This is wrong, it shall be displayed only on either side!
Dies ist falsch, es soll auf einer Seite angebracht werden!
This is wrong, it shall be displayed only on either side!

xqText.lang: Ein nach allen Seiten blinkendes gelbes Licht zeigt an:
An all around flashing yellow light indicates:

xqiText.lang: Vessel restricted in her ability to maneuver

xqText.lang: Ein Schiff das auf den westlichen Flüssen stromabwärts fährt begegnet einem anderen Schiff, dass stromaufwärts fährt. Welches Schiff hat Vorfahrt?
A vessel proceeding downstream in a narrow channel on the Western Rivers sights another vessel moving upstream. Which vessel has the right of way?

xqiText.lang: Das Schiiff, das stromaufwärts gegen die Strömung fährt
The vessel moving upstream against the current
Das Schiiff, das stromabwärts mit Strömung fährt
The vessel moving downstream with a following current (*)
Das Schiff, dass sich am nächsten zur Flussmitte befindet
The vessel located more towards the channel centerline
Das Schiff, dass als erstes sein Horn ertönen lässt
The vessel sounding the first whistle signal

xqText.lang: Ein Schiff, dass auf Grund gelaufen ist, soll folgende Lichter anzeigen:
A vessel aground shall exhibit which of the following lights:

xqiText.lang: Zwei rote Rundlichter in vertikaler Linie (*)
two all-round red lights in a vertical line (*)
Zwei Rundlichter in vertikaler Linie, dass obere weiss und das untere rot
two all-round lights in a vertical line, the upper being white and the lower red
Drei Rundlichter in vertikaler Linie, das oberste und unterste der Lichter rot und das mittlere weiss
Three all-round lights in a vertical line where the highest and lowest of these lights shall be red and the middle light shall be white

Congratulations! You passed the exam successfully!
